name: Sheraton Burlington Hotel and Conference Center

reviews.title: Mixed Bag
reviews.text: We just spent two nights at the Sheraton Burlington to attend UVM graduation. Our experience was mixed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was wonderful and clean. We arrived at 12:30 after notifying them in advance we would be attending a wedding there and were hoping to check-in early. Which they let us no questions asked since they had an open room. Great room extremely clean. Bed was wonderful, staff was extremely polite, and checkout was even easier. Lovely stay wish it was a little closer to downtown but a quick cab ride is all it is.
reviews.title: Everything you want for an overnight stay!

reviews.text: We were pleased with the size, cleanliness, and apperance of our Starwood floor king room. It featured a very nice flat-screen TV and comfortable sitting area with couch, chair, and work desk. The bathroom was clean and nice and it seemed that the room had been newly redone. We also had a nice view of the mountains and were able to park our car right outside the elevator to our floor.
reviews.title: nice, clean rooms - average service
Horrible service
reviews.text: Of the two restaurants, the main one was closed every time i checked. I therefore ended up going to the pub a couple times to get dinner for my family and myself. Here the service was very slow and the selection on the menu was tiny. The decor and crowd were all very '80s. But hey, it's a pub.
The hallways and outside doors are really showing some wear and tear, but this was not the case in our room.
reviews.title: GREAT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For roughly the same price (at certain times of the year), you can get a two-room suite that is nicer, cleaner, more luxurious (and obviously much larger) - complete with a full-size fridge, microwave, and kitchenette, at the Doubletree down the street on Williston Rd. The Sheraton is a nice but the Doubletree would be my pick.
reviews.title: Car Vandelized and Bad Security

reviews.text: My husband and I took our 4 teenagers to Burlington to look at colleges. We arrived Friday afternoon and were very happy with our adjoining rooms. Our room had a nice comfortable king size bed, flatscreen LCD TV, and was very clean. The kids room had 2 double beds which we were told were comfortable also. Our only complaint about the room was that we were not able to low the temp in the room. My husband who is in the construction trade couldn't even figure out the thermostat. When we called we were told that someone would come in while we were out during that night for dinner. Needless to say it didn't get done. We just ended up turning off the system all together.
reviews.title: Family Friendly

reviews.text: The kids enjoyed the pool and fitness room. They too were very clean. The Tuckaway Pub Staff were pleasant and the over all atmosphere was pleasant.
reviews.title: Looks classy, but doesn't go the extra step for comfort.

likes.disliked: — Getting sick; the staff; EXPENSIVE internet access (how LAME!!!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2003, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast at their resturant and couldn't get over the price of the meal. $10+ change for eggs, bacon and toast. We only did that once after the bill arrived.
reviews.title: a conference center in anywhere usa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vermont is a killer with taxes just to make anyone aware. 11% beverage and food tax. Now...I thought Mass was call Taxachusetts. Vermont is a whole lot worse.
reviews.title: went above and beyond

reviews.text: Burlington is a fun college town. Some good lil places to have meals. People were friendly and easy going. I loved the area and I am hoping that one of my twins decides to attend one of the college there. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: terrible service

description: Sheraton Burlington Hotel & Conference Center is near Lake Champlain, Church Street, skiing, and I-89. As Vermont's largest hotel, we have 30,000 sq ft of meeting space and free airport transport.
